bow: really sorry if this does belong here but just need to talk to someone who do know gave birth six months ago it was fairly easy labour both and the little one was fine ve had it so much easier than most parents have supportive so should be happy really should but not do feel anything for my son ve never liked kids and we did intend to become pregnant was told that things would be different when it was my own child that would be overwhelmed by intense love but not care for my son more out of sense of duty than motherly instincts realise that he now my responsibility and it my job as his mother to take care of him but do love him he just squirming poop machine going to talk to my doctor about ppd but what if it is that what if just not fit for motherhood what if dunno broken just felt the need to vent bit if this does belong here let me know and ll delete it good call on the dr ppd sounds like it may be likely culprit you re not broken you re not bad mom everyone moms differently ❤️ positive it ppd or ppa anxiety do beat yourself up too much it happens to so many women with my first baby just could wait till she got cuter and toddler aged so she could do more fun stuff sort of just went through the motions till she got to be there is so much pressure as mothers to be madly in love with our infants and to be this perfect completely sane pretty warm and kind goddess but that never the case especially in this society where mothers can be so isolated and alone and judged back in the day when mothers felt these feelings they had to just bury then and cope the best they could ppd was rampant with families having 10 kids and mothers just having no say in the matter use your resources and definitely get help definitely call your doc it sounds lot like ppd if it not then that okay too there ways to be good mom even without that crazy love that folks talk about there more than one way to be good parent it really common to not feel in love with your child at first did with my first and oh my felt so guilty still do but when talk about it people come out of the woodwork to say yes me too it so common and hard and guilt inducing love him now not broken or defective it just took time you will too and see doctor ppd and ppa happen and can be treated it not instant love for everyone it tiny stranger that changed your whole life and it can be really hard you may be dealing with some depression and that very normal definitely tell your doctor but also know that it can take while for some to grow bond with baby once they get little older and laugh and smile at you or babble it can feel more real guy and you may not be looking for my advice but this sounds like my wife after our first son was born hear me out for minute we live in culture that talks all about the unconditional love between mother and child you see it hear it and are told how amazing the bond between the two of you will be how your motherly instincts will kick in at some point that is bullshit for some women sure it there but for the first few months of your child life they are mewling infant begging for food or sleep or new diaper they take and take and do really give anything back at that point you re pouring everything you ve got into caring for them and not reaping much benefit at the time you care for your son which is great about month into my son life my wife and sat down and talked to her she seemed out of it she was getting more and more short with me and our son she was getting frustrated easily we talked about how she was feeling completely and totally overwhelmed how she felt she was bad mom because she did have that unconditional love how she felt like she did necessarily love our son but was just going through the motions day in and day out we talked about how she was doing everything she could we talked about how love is something we all have to work at even and especially within our marriage we talked about ppd and suggested she go talk with her obgyn she did she got some support through conversation and medication and she started to feel better my son and her have great bond now he he can show love lot more towards her now and could do so as he got older and older she started seeing her effort reciprocated from him and they started building bond my advice talk to your so share with him her how you are feeling and be honest you need each other right now more than ever talk to your doctor share with them all your feelings and do hide any way all of your feelings are valid right now and need to be discussed by sharing them and putting them out there you can start to address them if you have yet look around your town for some mommy support groups in my area there is mommy group especially for moms dealing with ppd you are strong enough for this and you are amazing had really rough start with my first did look forward to my day until around months did have especially strong feelings for my baby because it all very one sided in the beginning now she is almost and can have conversation with me there is actually meaningful relationship forming now removed removed agree my son was veeeery much wanted we went through fertility treatments and everything and really wanted to bond with him but it still took months to really make connection and sure that did have any ppd even before he was born called him freeloader that moves into our appartment babys take so much energy especially mothers do really get any me time your ressources are drained and you need to be empathetic all the time it exhausting now my son is almost 20 months and still takes up lot of our energy but he real person now with which can make connection and that makes it sooo much easier to care for him not everyone has that instant love for their kid for me its growing slowly as get to know him better that being said you should probably feel something the detachment and sense of duty feeling you describe was my main symptom of ppd my doctor said that classic symptom so encourage you to speak to your doctor once we started to manage the ppd ve noticed even if not overwhelmed with love still feel love for him you re not bad mom you to help me my husband at the time who promised to help with him if had another vamped everyday it was struggle he fifteen now and love him so very much it took several months to even like him but of slack yes completely agree with this struggled with ppd after having my son and remember feeling the same way can not stress enough please get help put it off for so long thinking would be fine but doctor but wanted to chime in like everyone else and say it took me long time to feel more than motherly responsibility for my daughter honestly do know anyone who felt that immediate connection and think the perpetuation that instant love is the norm is very dangerous and insensitive you do have to have emotions like those you see on tv at that age child has so little of what we understand as personality feel confident that as your kid grows and develops unique personality that you will develop the kind of connection to them that we all have with our parents and do feel disappointed in yourself for having sense of duty it beautiful thing too am almost months pp and dealing with ppd ocd it really sounds like you are suffering from ppd the worst part about motherhood is this idea that is pushed on us that we should feel love the second we see our baby even before that to be honest didn feel much till months cared for him and maybe there was love their but didn feel over the moon my husband always said that love doesn have to be you gushing over the baby all day but taking good care of him making sure he fed and cared for that love my therapist also says that bonding takes lifetime not an instant it so true please know that you aren alone in this and there is help out there try to google and see if your area state has postpartum program resource group was able to find mine through my states program there is lot of ambivalence in motherhood and no one talks about it we are told we have to be 100 in love all the time taking care of baby running errands up keeping our homes all while keeping ourselves together it just isn that way please don feel guilty you sound like great mom agreed entirely when mine was born felt sense of duty she needed me had to step up this is what we trained for that kind of feeling she ten weeks now and after spending almost all of our time together so far we re starting to build good bond lucky was spared struggling with ppa ppd ve gotten to take lot of time off work have ton of support know lot of moms aren so lucky and that lucky combination of circumstances is probably partly why we ve been getting along as well as we have actually enjoyed being mom thats okay too what were you re symptoms for ppd ocd sorry if being intrusive you don have to answer don be sorry really open about it find that helps me in my recovery so basically have these obsessive intrusive thoughts basically an unwanted thought pops into my head usually it something upsetting distressing then get anxious about it because afraid the thought is true even though in my heart know it not one of my main thoughts is that fear that don actually love my son thought will sort of pop in like well maybe you don love him and you actually want to run away then ll get upset with myself because what if that actually how am feeling it also called pure ocd the one thing about it is that anyone who has it is the least likely to act on their thoughts but the thoughts can be about anything and sometimes there are compulsions but not all the time which is why so many people don think they have ocd to be honest my other thoughts surround being afraid ll hurt my son in some sort of violent way know would never do it but this has been the scariest one and one of the most common in postpartum women symptoms can also be constant checking of things like doors stove baby because of these sort of what if thoughts obsessively worrying is also big symptom it true that once they start to show love amp appreciation things feel less daunting have ppd and in the beginning it was constant work for no reward not even smile struggled with bonding because of this my son is almost months now and at least get some laughs and snuggles my son looks for me for comfort and seems to love when around him idk why but that has helped me so much it really is such thankless job but it does get easier that not how this works adoptive parents can be abusive adopting parents can be very loving all women suffer in different ways when they have child just because woman is struggling with something does make adoption the solution every situation is going to have its flaws whether or not you can see them dont have my baby yet but this sounds to me like completely normal and logical reaction to having to sacrifice your time body sleep and other needs to someone you cant really know yet if we fall in love at first sight then it not the person we love but chemicals telling us we love someone we dont even know already feeling those in love feelings but they dont mean that ll like her when she actually becomes person it hopefully will help me through the hard time but if were so enamoured with being mom there would be no reason to love my screaming monster until got to know who she actually is doing your duty is hard and dont think you should feel guilt when you re basically saint at this stage it took me long time to really see my baby as an actual person rather than very high maintenance pet not kid person either and although my pregnancy was planned had lot of fears that would feel more of an obligation towards him than overwhelming love the love really grows over time and as your baby becomes more like human person expressing emotions and smiling and interacting with you it can be hard to feel love towards someone who is not giving you much back this does make you bad mother as long as you choose to take care of him and meet his needs you are better than lot of mothers out there who do even do that try not to overthink your emotions and just try to enjoy your time with him as much as you can felt the same way after my son was born in fact felt it up until almost recently and he 13 months now as soon as he was born stop crying all the time but it didn help me love him more it was definitely like you said necessary love had to love and provide for him or he wouldn survive felt so much guilt about that for long time but as of couple months ago notice that literally love him more every day get bummed when he not super excited to see me because he having more fun with grandma but when he cuddles me kisses me smiles back at me die love him more than ever thought possible you re not broken sometimes it takes time it ok to have feelings like the top reply said honestly didn feel that earth shattering love instantly like you op did not want children it was hard transition for me every time someone talked or talks about the instant immense love he she felt for baby felt bad about myself because had time felt good about myself and life and still did have those gushy feelings about him at first huuuuuge hug to you because you are alone have little ones and for the first few months felt nothing but sense of duty toward them did fall in love instantly like most people claim to it was very slow build towards love even slower for my second child did have ppd and that led to many many doubts about
